I think the Juggernaut rework is the worst still by far.

- Garen still doesn't have a solid niche in the game/a reason to be picked over someone else really
- Mordekaiser AND Skarner both need full scale VGUs after their reworks
- Darius is still considered one of the most annoying top lane champions to fight in the game, even if he was an overall success in making him a little less binary

Meanwhile, all of the Tanks are only really weak or too strong due to balance issues, not gameplay mechanics. None of them in my eyes need VGUs after their updates.

sej ruined post-rework regardless of her balance state

and there's no 'niche' to be had with any of them, all 3 are just cc bots plain and simple

I don't see a reason for her to need a large scale rework after her current rework though as of yet, which is more than can be said for the Juggernauts 3 patches after their rework. Within two months, it was clear Mordekaiser and Skarner were royally screwed by the update.

Also, even if we are going by simple balance post-update, the Juggernaut update still far surpasses the Tank rework since it went beyond just the champions that were reworked's balance states. The Juggernaut items really messed with the game for a couple patches:

{{item:3053}} used to be able to stack with {{item:3156}} and could provide an AD user with a ridiculously high amount of protection from burst.
{{item:3748}} wasn't even hardly used by Juggernauts and was instead abused off the planet by on-hit effect users by allowing them to build some extremely durable off-tank builds. For a few patches, Master Yi was an actual problem.
{{item:3742}} for a little while was far overtuned.

> and there's no 'niche' to be had with any of them, all 3 are just cc bots plain and simple

Define a CC bot though, because last time I checked, a Tank's main job was to apply CC to the enemy team and take hits. Furthermore, it's not like they all do it in a similar way. The difference in all of their ultimates and how they apply CC is very notable. While I can't comment on their balance state, as Maokai has been kind of screwed this time around and Zac kind of overtuned, the Juggernauts are still in a much worse state.

P.S. Maokai's niche is rooting the enemy team and vision, Zac's is long distance engagement, and Sejuani's is melee heavy hard engage. Sejuani probably has the most generic niche, but she can shape a game a lot different from the other tanks since her E has such a low cool down and can be stacked by melee allies. At most, Sejuani might need some minor touch-ups to further emphasize her niche.

> the Juggernaut update still far surpasses the Tank rework since it went beyond just the champions that were reworked's balance states

so did the tank update, nerfs to health across the board have had echoing effects on bruisers, with a lot of them taking a dip in power that Riot now has to take their time compensating individually, unless they happened to benefit massively from the AD changes 

>Furthermore, it's not like they all do it in a similar way.

the end result is the same, so who cares? Sejuani ~~can~~ could engage from a distance, too, Sion and Malphite do it as well. How you do 'X' thing slightly differently should not be considered a niche; a niche is having strengths that others, or at least very few others, have. And this, funny enough, is one of the things that the Juggernauts do better than any other subgroup. 

As stupid as I think Poppy is she's a good example of an actually niche tank because of her W, E and R serving as a _reliable_ hard-stop to dashes. She functions excellently as an anti-mobility tank, even if I think she's still too good against immobile targets. Other tanks can interrupt mobility with their own displacements, but most of them can miss where Poppy can't, and they don't usually have 3 opportunities to stop a Lee Sin flanking. 

Ignoring her now terrible animations and mediocre balance state, Sejuani's rework is especially shit because her 'niche' isn't in her control. You have to beg soloQ teams to pick melee champions so that you can actually be a stun bot and not just a chogath-tier meat shield when it's time to fight 5v5. And that's all she has now; stunning people. Previously she was far closer to a very tanky diver, or at least a hybrid, because she followed a similar pattern as Hecarim but with spammy slows attached; ult onto the enemy team and then beat down the closest carry, basically a semi-carry herself. Old Sejuani had far more skill expression in decision making; because of her nature as an AoE-heavy tank with high DPS she had to choose between running one person down or spreading her E stacks to as many people as possible to slow all of them and set her team up, as well as deciding when to ult. New Sejuani has lost this; you'll press E as soon as it's available, because there's one outcome; one person will be stunned. R is the same way; now with piss-poor initiation, R is only used as a combo reset to double her stun time. The only thing I actually like about the rework is that she can kill Scuttle in 3 seconds instead of having to chase it around the river for 10.
